intro: Cyrtandra gillettiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is an herbaceous perennial with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rainforest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
